snippet: After a program to teach children 8 and up to code proves successful, its creators adapt it for even younger students.
abstract: Scratch, computer programming language aimed at children age 8 and older, uses colorful stackable icons to represent sequencing and logic of computer code; developers are testing Scratch Jr, aimed at children in kindergarten through second grade.
lead_paragraph: After a program to teach children 8 and up to code proves successful, its creators adapt it for even younger students.
